emails.subject: Re: Ukraine soil moisture dashboard not updated
emails.to: Pablo Figueroa; Jebrane Ben Salem; Support Dnext
emails.body_text:
"but besides the "request" do u think it makes sense we made this change?

sorry for insisting maybe too much but i dont think this makes sense."

personally, I agree with you. I do not think that not using a crop mask for weather time series is a good idea.

"i think we said that we would show non crop mask data only for missing regions and this did not implied changing everything, including the things that were working fine. "

This turns out to be very computationally expensive, so we have to make do with either cropmasked no non-cropmasked data for now.

"problem for me is that from one week to the other i see i have a lot of data missing."

I appreciate that and I'm sorry for all the issues caused. Hopefully it won't be an issue any further very soon.
________________________________

From: Pablo Figueroa <pablo.figueroa@dnext.io>
Sent: 20 March 2025 08:42
To: Martin Keller <martin.keller@dnext.io>; Jebrane Ben Salem <jebrane.bensalem@dnext.io>; Support Dnext <support@dnext.io>
Subject: Re: Ukraine soil moisture dashboard not updated 
 
but besides the "request" do u think it makes sense we made this change?

sorry for insisting maybe too much but i dont think this makes sense.

i think we said that we would show non crop mask data only for missing regions and this did not implied changing everything, including the things that were working fine. 


problem for me is that from one week to the other i see i have a lot of data missing.
________________________________

From: Martin Keller <martin.keller@dnext.io>
Sent: Thursday, March 20, 2025 5:37 AM
To: Pablo Figueroa <pablo.figueroa@dnext.io>; Jebrane Ben Salem <jebrane.bensalem@dnext.io>; Support Dnext <support@dnext.io>
Subject: Re: Ukraine soil moisture dashboard not updated 
 
"sorry but i still dont understand. before we did not have any problem. why we have to change?"

we made the change following requests from Bastien and Lucas who had raised issues with the cropmasked data missing regions on different maps. This is an issue for both historical and forecast data.


________________________________

From: Pablo Figueroa <pablo.figueroa@dnext.io>
Sent: 20 March 2025 08:35
To: Martin Keller <martin.keller@dnext.io>; Jebrane Ben Salem <jebrane.bensalem@dnext.io>; Support Dnext <support@dnext.io>
Subject: Re: Ukraine soil moisture dashboard not updated 
 
sorry but i still dont understand. before we did not have any problem. why we have to change?
one thing is ERA5 soil moisture and another thing is the precip data
________________________________

From: Martin Keller <martin.keller@dnext.io>
Sent: Thursday, March 20, 2025 5:29 AM
To: Pablo Figueroa <pablo.figueroa@dnext.io>; Jebrane Ben Salem <jebrane.bensalem@dnext.io>; Support Dnext <support@dnext.io>
Subject: Re: Ukraine soil moisture dashboard not updated 
 
what has changed is that we are not using a crop mask at all for the new data sets, as discussed in the Monday meetings.

Russian geographies (oblasts) are so large, especially in the north and east of the country, that using a crop mask is at least for now needed for producing values representative for agricultural activity, so for now we are sticking with the cropmasked time series there.
I am, however, producing non-cropmasked values for Russia as well to eventually replace all cropmasked values with non-cropmasked ones.
________________________________

From: Pablo Figueroa <pablo.figueroa@dnext.io>
Sent: 20 March 2025 08:10
To: Martin Keller <martin.keller@dnext.io>; Jebrane Ben Salem <jebrane.bensalem@dnext.io>; Support Dnext <support@dnext.io>
Subject: Re: Ukraine soil moisture dashboard not updated 
 
but what have we changed? this is the same source (ERA5) right? crop mask is different?

why this is not affecting other ocuntries like Russia?
________________________________

From: Martin Keller <martin.keller@dnext.io>
Sent: Thursday, March 20, 2025 5:00 AM
To: Pablo Figueroa <pablo.figueroa@dnext.io>; Jebrane Ben Salem <jebrane.bensalem@dnext.io>; Support Dnext <support@dnext.io>
Subject: Re: Ukraine soil moisture dashboard not updated 
 
as discussed in the Monday meetings, we produce a new alternative data set that does not use a crop mask. 

This was done in order to avoid some of the issues with "missing" geographies raised by Bastien and Luca, which were due to the crop masks used flagging no crops in them.

The backfill is running this week at a pace of about 2 years per day (quite a bit of data to recompute), so in the absence of technical issues we'll have the full backfill without using crop masks by the weekend.
________________________________

what has changed is that we are not using a crop mask at all for the new data sets, as discussed in the Monday meetings.

Russian geographies (oblasts) are so large, especially in the north and east of the country, that using a crop mask is at least for now needed for producing values representative for agricultural activity, so for now we are sticking with the cropmasked time series there.
I am, however, producing non-cropmasked values for Russia as well to eventually replace all cropmasked values with non-cropmasked ones.
